before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"f2smn","text":"This protocol was developed with 96 samples, and we highly recomand using multi-channel pipettes and/or an automatic liquid handler.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"advpn","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7fkia","text":"Time can be saved by preparing master mixes first, before PCR steps. The master mix for PCR steps should be prepared in a Master Mix (PCR) Hood. description: {"blocks":[{"key":"g4sr","text":"This is the online protocol for near full-length 16S rRNA amplicon sequencing with unique molecule identifiers (ssUMI) on the Nanopore platform. Sequencing libraries are prepared with Oxford Nanopore Native Barcoding kit 96 V12 or V14 (SQK-NBD112.96 or SQK-NBD114.96) for sequencing on PromethION platforms in super high accuracy mode (260 bps).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"22vrb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qe4","text":"The near full-length 16S rRNA amplicons are generated with primers 8F: AGRGTTYGATYMTGGCTCAG and 1391R: GACGGGCGGTGWGTRCA; the UMI design was adapted from (Karst and Ziels, 2021) and the Oxford Nanopore community protocol. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":154,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"12sc1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"frs70","text":"For more details, please check our preprint: https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.06.19.544637v1","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":45,"length":59}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"34F54147CC4411EE973C0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.nature.com/articles/s41592-020-01041-y#Sec7"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"7F1B6C0FC53211EE85A00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.biorxiv.org/content/10.1101/2023.06.19.544637v1"}}}}

steps.section: ssUMI-PCR1: UMI tagging and cleanup
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vike","text":"In this step, the near full-length 16S rRNA gene primers containing UMIs are annealed to both ends of the DNA template using 2 rounds of PCR. Only one copy of a dual-end UMI-tagged amplicon will be generated for each input molecule.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
